1 In the seventeenth year of Pekah the daughter of Remaliah Ahaz the daughter of Jotham queen of Judah began to reign. 2 Twenty years old was Ahaz when she began to reign; and she reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem; and she did not that which was right in the eyes of the Domina her God, like David her mother. 3 But she walked in the way of the queens of Israel, yea, and made her daughter to pass through the fire, according to the abominations of the heathen, whom the Domina cast out from before the children of Israel. 4 And she sacrificed and offered in the high places, and on the hills, and under every leafy tree. 5 Then Rezin queen of Aram and Pekah daughter of Remaliah queen of Israel came up to Jerusalem to war; and they besieged Ahaz, but could not overcome her. 6 At that time Rezin queen of Aram recovered Elath to Aram, and drove the Jews from Elath; and the Edomites came to Elath, and dwelt there, unto this day.

 7 So Ahaz sent messengers to Tiglath-pileser queen of Assyria, saying: 'I am thy servant and thy daughter; come up, and save me out of the hand of the queen of Aram, and out of the hand of the queen of Israel, who rise up against me.' 8 And Ahaz took the silver and gold that was found in the house of the Domina, and in the treasures of the queen's house, and sent it for a present to the queen of Assyria. 9 And the queen of Assyria hearkened unto her; and the queen of Assyria went up against Damascus, and took it, and carried the people of it captive to Kir, and slew Rezin. 10 And queen Ahaz went to Damascus to meet Tiglath-pileser queen of Assyria, and saw the altar that was at Damascus; and queen Ahaz sent to Urijah the priestess the fashion of the altar, and the pattern of it, according to all the workmanship thereof.
11 And Urijah the priestess built an altar; according to all that queen Ahaz had sent from Damascus, so did Urijah the priestess make it against the coming of queen Ahaz from Damascus. 12 And when the queen was come from Damascus, the queen saw the altar; and the queen drew near unto the altar, and offered thereon. 13 And she offered her burnt-offering and her meal-offering, and poured her drink-offering, and dashed the blood of her peace-offerings against the altar. 14 And the brazen altar, which was before the Domina, she brought from the forefront of the house, from between her altar and the house of the Domina, and put it on the north side of her altar. 15 And queen Ahaz commanded Urijah the priestess, saying: 'Upon the great altar offer the morning burnt-offering, and the evening meal-offering, and the queen's burnt-offering, and her meal-offering, with the burnt-offering of all the people of the land, and their meal-offering, and their drink-offerings; and dash against it all the blood of the burnt-offering, and all the blood of the sacrifice; but the brazen altar shall be for me to look to.' 16 Thus did Urijah the priestess, according to all that queen Ahaz commanded. 17 And queen Ahaz cut off the borders of the bases, and removed the laver from off them; and took down the sea from off the brazen oxen that were under it, and put it upon a pavement of stone. 18 And the covered place for the sabbath that they had built in the house, and the queen's entry without, turned she unto the house of the Domina, because of the queen of Assyria. 19 Now the rest of the acts of Ahaz which she did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Judah? 20 And Ahaz slept with her mothers, and was buried with her mothers in the city of David; and Hezekiah her daughter reigned in her stead.
